title: Eventually close the host search progress dialog (#251)
message:
Eventually close the host search progress dialog (#251)

Changing the orientation of the device while a host search was running
resulted in a progress dialog that was never closed. The app needed to
be killed.

This is fixed by switching to a DialogFragment for the progress dialog
as well as saving the dialog state prior to the orientation change and
restoring from it after.

Currently, only ListSearchTabActivity has been moved to using that
DialogFragment. All other activities that might show a progress dialog
still use the old DialogHandler version.

The HostListAdapter now also has a resetDataset method which accepts a
new list, clears the old dataset, sets the specified list as the new
one, and notifies itself of the change in order to update the UI.

Also, the string "search_results" that spanned 2 activities is now
defined in a constant.

Fixes:  #243
Closes: #251

title: Move hidden send button in HostContactActivity (#250)
message:
Move hidden send button in HostContactActivity (#250)

The send button was hidden by the software keyboard. With adjustResize,
the activity's layout gets resized automatically once the keyboard is
being shown. By doing this, the send button is being pushed upwards.

With a 5" smartphone this works quite well as there is still enough
space for six lines of message text. However, on smaller devices this
might lead to undesirable behaviour.

Fixes:  #244
Closes: #250

title: Enable Travis CI to auto-deploy APKs
message:
Enable Travis CI to auto-deploy APKs

The resulting APK of a CI build is now automatically uploaded to GitHub
for tagged revisions. They are signed with the same key that is used in
the Google Play Store. All secrets are encrypted and only visible to
Travis CI.

title: Adapt feedback API changes (#261)
message:
Adapt feedback API changes (#261)

The server changed its API in /user/{userId}/json_recommendations.
Namely, it removed "_value" from some fields. Also, the hostingDate is
no longer a number but a formatted string.

title: Improve performance (#260)
message:
Improve performance (#260)

Improve performance slightly by avoiding unnecessary unboxing/boxing and
storing states as local variable whenever possible.

title: Drop targetSdkVersion to 22.
message:
Drop targetSdkVersion to 22.

Beginning in Android 6.0 (API level 23), users grant permissions to
apps while the app is running, not when they install the app. We are
not ready for this, yet. Having a targetSdkVersion lower than 23 allows
to use permissions the old way. This fixes crashes on devices running on
Android 6.0+.

title: Fix performance penalty in String processing (#259)
message:
Fix performance penalty in String processing (#259)

The method defines a String object and loops through the hosts to add
their info to the String, under the hood the String is converted to a
StringBuffer/StringBuilder, appended to, and converted back to a String.
This can lead to a cost quadratic in the number of iterations, as the
growing string is recopied in each iteration. This commit replaces
String with StringBuilder and convert it back to the String object when
the string process is over.

title: Make TLS SNI work (#256)
message:
Make TLS SNI work (#256)

warmshowers.org switched to a hoster which uses SNI. On Android < 6.0
the Apache HTTPClient does not support this out of the box. Therefore,
the app is no longer able to verify connections with the server and
thus fails to operate. However, a fix on devices running Android 4.2+
is possible by using the native hostname verifier. For Android 4.1 and
earlier it is possibly supported through reflexion on the same methods.

title: Make the project building and green again (#255)
message:
Make the project building and green again (#255)

* Use legacy http library

The org.apache.http library has been deprecated. It is now available as
org.apache.http.legacy.

* Switch to newer library versions

Gradle, the build tools, SDK and many libraries are brought to newer
versions (as far as compatible).

* Fix all the lint errors and some of the warnings

* Make the tests compile again

Adds jUnit as a testCompile dependency (thank you @PattaFeuFeu) and
fixes outdated calls to the MapSearchJsonParser constructor.

* Make the tests green again

All the tests failed. The test resources directory was wrong (or
outdated) and needed to be moved from src/test/res/ to
src/test/resources/. The mock server replies were not reflecting real
ones and missed some properties. And a few test cases were not updated
when code was changed in the past.

* Set a default debug keystore

Adds a keystore for signing debug apk files. This allows installation
of arbitrary debug versions without the hassle of dealing with
different signing keys. The release keystore settings have to be set in
local.properties.

title: Add integration for Travis CI (#254)
message:
Add integration for Travis CI (#254)

Travis CI (https://travis-ci.org) does continuous integration testing
on every commit and pull request. master is currently neither building
nor are the tests green. This would allow to discover situations like
this at PR time.

Had to bring this in early because I'm hitting it in debugging other problems.

title: Followup to #165 on switching to FusedAPI - fix crash
message:
Followup to #165 on switching to FusedAPI - fix crash

Turned out that because both the maps setup and the play services connect are now
asynchronous that the onConnect() could fire before we had a map to act on.
Changed the mGoogleApiClient.connect() to be after the map has been set up.

title: URLEncoding has to be done with utf-8 specified, or ...
message:
URLEncoding has to be done with utf-8 specified, or ...

Fixes #158

ISO-8859-1 gets used instead, which will really damage utf-8 strings.
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/10942205/creating-a-urlencodedformentity-from-a-list-of-namevaluepairs-throws-a-nullpoint

title: Update gradle plugin version
message:
Update gradle plugin version

This went crazy with 1.x upgrade to Android Studio, apparently
for no reason. I don't know why we should specify it more
carefully than this.

The actual error was
The project is using an unsupported version of the Android Gradle plug-in
which is really hard to track down to just a classpath in the
build.gradle!

title: Fix JSONException case in doSearch() - fixes #139
message:
Fix JSONException case in doSearch() - fixes #139

This actually was pretty bad - it was failing with 'no internet connection' when
there were no hosts, because it was always assuming that there was an
accounts object, and when there were no hits, it wasn't there.

title: Seems that the 'auto' activity tracking isn't quite there
message:
Seems that the 'auto' activity tracking isn't quite there

This adds the start/stop that are required on pre-api14
And also programmatically sets 'auto'

title: Add support for starred hosts on map
message:
Add support for starred hosts on map

This fixes #102 - now all starred hosts are shown on map
even when no network connection.

message: Add languages spoken to host info, fixes #41

message:
Add label and geo URI to send to maps app

title: Implements a basic usage of Google Analytics
message:
Implements a basic usage of Google Analytics

This fixes #82, but is just the first step
It took a couple of days for GA to start reporting, so
I'm not completely confident that we're getting enough info
yet, and there may have to be more app tracking added.

title: Fixes #110 by using a webview for 'view on site'
message:
Fixes #110 by using a webview for 'view on site'

This incidentally adds the ability to leave feedback using the site form.
It doesn't replace doing this 'right' per #40, but it's an interesting
experiment. I'm certainly willing to pull it out.
